Uses of Package
org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation

  • Packages that use org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation 
    Package Description
    org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation  
    org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.mmextensions.archimate  
    org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.visitors  
  • Classes in org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation used by org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation 
    Class and Description
    Requirement
    Requirement vnull In the end, a business goal must be realized by a plan or concrete change goal, which may or may not require a new system or changes to an existing system.
  • Classes in org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.layers.motivation used by org.modelio.archimate.metamodel.mmextensions.archimate 
    Class and Description
    Assessment
    Assessment vnull An assessment may reveal strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, or threats for some area of interest.
    Constraint
    Constraint vnull In contrast to a requirement, a constraint does not prescribe some intended functionality of the system to be realized, but imposes a restriction on the way it operates or may be realized.
    Driver
    Driver vnull Drivers may be internal, in which case they are usually associated with a stakeholder, and are often called "concerns".
    Goal
    Goal vnull In principle, a goal can represent anything a stakeholder may desire, such as a state of affairs, or a produced value.
    Meaning
    Meaning vnull A meaning represents the interpretation of an element of the architecture.
    Outcome
    Outcome vnull Outcomes are high-level, business-oriented results produced by capabilities of an organization, and by inference by the core elements of its architecture that realize these capabilities.
    Principle
    Principle vnull Principles are strongly related to goals and requirements.
    Requirement
    Requirement vnull In the end, a business goal must be realized by a plan or concrete change goal, which may or may not require a new system or changes to an existing system.
    Stakeholder
    Stakeholder vnull This definition is based on the definition in the TOGAF framework [4].
    Value
    Value vnull Value may apply to what a party gets by selling or making available some product or service, or it may apply to what a party gets by buying or obtaining access to it.
